results.title: The potential effect of metformin on cognitive and other symptom dimensions in patients with schizophrenia and antipsychotic-induced weight gain: a systematic review, meta-analysis, and meta-regression
results.text_hl: Our aim is to whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as add-on therapy improved or not @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@SCZ@@@ symptoms, with a particular interest in cognitive functions.

The potential effect of metformin on cognitive and other symptom dimensions in patients with schizophrenia and antipsychotic-induced weight gain: a systematic review, meta-analysis, and meta-regression Front Psychiatry. 2023;14():1215807. PMID: 37502816

results.title: Efficacy and Safety of Adjunctive Aripiprazole, Metformin, and Paeoniae-Glycyrrhiza Decoction for Antipsychotic-Induced Hyperprolactinemia: A Network Meta-Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials
results.text_hl: RCTs that used @CHEMICAL_Aripiprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068180 @@@aripiprazole@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or PGD as the primary medications for @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@ were excluded.

results.title: Co-prescription of aripiprazole on prolactin levels in long-term hospitalized chronic schizophrenic patients with co-morbid type 2 diabetes: A retrospective clinical study
results.text_hl: In our study, the conventional @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ dose (1-2 g/day) used to treat @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@ with co-morbid T2DM also had the same function of lowering @GENE_PRL @GENE_5617 @@@PRL@@@ levels and showed a negative dose-dependence of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ dose and @GENE_PRL @GENE_5617 @@@PRL@@@ levels.

citations.NLM: Liu X, Sun X, Li L, Zeng K, Li Y, Gao Y, Ma J. Co-prescription of aripiprazole on prolactin levels in long-term hospitalized chronic schizophrenic patients with co-morbid type 2 diabetes: A retrospective clinical study Front Psychiatry. 2023;14():1124691. PMID: 36816406

results.title: Metformin improves cognitive impairment in patients with schizophrenia: associated with enhanced functional connectivity of dorsolateral prefrontal cortex
results.text_hl: The present study found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ effectively improves cognition in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@.

results.title: Metformin attenuates antipsychotic-induced metabolic dysfunctions in MK801-induced schizophrenia-like rats.
results.text_hl: Whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can reverse @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@AIMD@@@ and whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ affects the therapeutic effects of antipsychotics in animal models of @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@ are questions that still need to be investigated.

results.title: Adjunctive metformin for antipsychotic-induced dyslipidemia: a meta-analysis of randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials
results.text_hl: Twelve studies with 1215 @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (592 in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group and 623 in placebo group) were included and analyzed.

results.title: Risk of schizophrenia in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome: a nationwide population-based cohort study from Taiwan.
results.text_hl: After adjusting for above-mentioned covariates, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment had a protective effect against the incident @<m>DISEASE_Schizophrenia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012559 @@@schizophrenia@@@ compared to non-users (HR: 0.16, 95% CI: 0.06-0.41).

citations.NLM: Chen SF, Yang YC, Hsu CY, Shen YC. Risk of schizophrenia in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome: a nationwide population-based cohort study from Taiwan. J Psychosom Obstet Gynaecol. 2021 Dec;42(4):272-278. PMID: 32141403
